basics.name: Yash Verma
basics.label: Fullstack Web3 Engineer
basics.summary: I'm a full stack web3 developer who can build apps from the ground up. I've worked mostly at startups so I am used to wearing many hats. I also have an expertise in building scalable microservices, modern React frontends, and robust backends. Passionate about solving complex challenges in blockchain. Skilled in performance optimization, system design, and driving end-to-end project ownership.

education.degree: B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering

work.name: RTSN
work.summary: Oversaw the entire development lifecycle of numerous features, from ideation to deployment, leading to substantial enhancements in platform functionality, Engineered and implemented NFT minting on blockchain networks via smart contracts, ensuring secure, transparent, and efficient asset transactions
highlights: Architected and Developed Comprehensive Platform Features
Integrated blockchain, AI, LLMs, and gamification into platform functionality
Designed APIs and optimized backend for high performance and scalability
Worked cross-functionally to align technical solutions with business object

projects.name: WorkLedger
projects.description: A decentralized application for tipping and reviewing completed work on-chain, ensuring transparency and immutability of feedback.
highlights: Implemented tipping and testimonial functionality on-chain using Solidity smart contracts
Used Foundry for smart contract testing and deployment on Sepolia
Built a polished frontend using Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, Shadcn UI, and Framer Motion
Enabled users to leave verified on-chain reviews with ETH tips and ratings
Deployed the frontend on Vercel and verified contracts with Forge

projects.name: On-Chain Comic Timeline
projects.description: A creative DApp that visualizes wallet activity like ETH transfers, NFT trades, and contract calls as comic-style cards, bringing a fun and engaging representation to blockchain transactions.
highlights: Visualized wallet activity as animated comic panels using Framer Motion
Parsed and categorized transactions such as ETH transfers, NFT trades, and contract calls using Ethers.js and Wagmi
Used OpenSea API to enrich NFT data with images and metadata
Created reusable comic card components for each transaction type
Designed a vibrant frontend using Next.js, Tailwind CSS, and Shadcn UI

projects.name: #30DaysOfSolidity
projects.description: A self-driven challenge to master smart contract development by building 30 production-ready Solidity contracts in 30 days, ranging from DeFi to NFTs and DAOs.
highlights: Built and deployed 30+ smart contracts using Solidity, Hardhat, and Foundry
Covered core topics like ERC-20, ERC-721, ERC-1155, AMMs, DAOs, staking, oracles, and yield farming
Created real-world projects including NFT marketplaces, escrow contracts, governance protocols, and liquidity pools
Shared daily learnings on Twitter and YouTube to help educate the Web3 community
Used GitHub for daily commits and versioning of smart contract logic

projects.name: Uniswap Liquidity Dashboard
projects.description: A real-time analytics dashboard to track and visualize liquidity pool data from Uniswap V3, helping users understand pool depths, volume, fees, and historical trends.
highlights: Fetched Uniswap V3 pool data using The Graph and visualized it with interactive charts
Displayed key metrics like total liquidity, volume, and fee earnings across pools
Integrated a historical price chart with zoom and time filters using charting libraries
Implemented dynamic pool selection for ETH, USDC, DAI, and other token pairs
Designed a clean, responsive dashboard UI using Next.js and Tailwind CSS

projects.name: StreamlineX
projects.description: An AI-powered productivity suite designed to automate workflows, summarize meetings, and manage tasks across teams using intelligent assistants and real-time collaboration.
highlights: Engineered the backend architecture using Node.js and PostgreSQL for scalable task and meeting management
Integrated OpenAI APIs to auto-summarize meetings and generate action items from transcripts
Built a real-time chat and task sync system using Socket.io
Designed collaborative dashboards with seamless UX for managing to-do lists, calendars, and notes
Implemented role-based access control (RBAC) and JWT authentication

projects.name: Token Exchange DApp
projects.description: A decentralized token trading platform enabling users to create, fill, and cancel token swap orders on-chain using a custom-built exchange smart contract.
highlights: Developed and deployed custom ERC-20 and Exchange smart contracts using Hardhat
Implemented order book logic for token swaps including order creation, matching, and cancellation
Built a fullstack UI with Next.js and Tailwind CSS for seamless token trading
Integrated Ethers.js for blockchain interactions and Redux for order state management
Tested smart contracts with custom scenarios to prevent reentrancy and ensure swap accuracy

projects.name: Crypto Soundbox
projects.description: A QR-based crypto payment system tailored for the Indian ecosystem, enabling users and merchants to send and receive crypto through simple sound or scan interactions.
highlights: Built a Web3-enabled payment system using QR codes to initiate on-chain transactions
Designed user and merchant flows for seamless crypto transfers with instant feedback
Used Solidity to write and deploy contracts for payment handling and event tracking
Integrated Ethers.js with a React frontend to manage wallet connections and transfer flows
Showcased the project at ETHGlobal Hackathon to demonstrate real-world crypto usability

projects.name: Unity Works
projects.description: A decentralized platform that assigns unique tokens to artists and enables organizations to exchange their tokens as a public endorsement of trust and collaboration.
highlights: Designed a token-based trust and endorsement system to quantify artistic credibility
Built smart contracts that allow organizations to send their tokens to artist wallets as proof of collaboration or recommendation
Focused on making artists' contributions persist beyond a project through on-chain recognition
Ensured transparent and immutable records of professional relationships and recommendations
Ideated and developed the concept as part of an initiative to empower independent creators

projects.name: Hobbinator
projects.description: A fun and quirky platform that helps users discover, track, and share their hobbies while gamifying personal growth through progress badges and streaks.
highlights: Built a fullstack application allowing users to log hobbies, set goals, and track progress over time
Implemented gamification features like badges, streak counters, and leaderboards to increase engagement
Integrated social sharing and public profiles to create a hobby-driven community
Used Next.js and Tailwind CSS for a responsive and vibrant frontend interface
Stored hobby data and user progress efficiently using MongoDB and Node.js

projects.name: BioDrop
projects.description: A Web3-powered digital identity platform that allows users to create and showcase a verifiable profile using blockchain credentials, project showcases, and social links.
highlights: Created a decentralized profile system where users can drop their bio, links, and Web3 projects
Integrated ENS and wallet-based login to verify user identity on-chain
Enabled users to add project links, contributions, and social media to a personalized on-chain profile
Focused on creator-first design to highlight portfolios and collaboration history
Designed an intuitive interface using Next.js, TailwindCSS, and Shadcn UI

projects.name: Personal Portfolio Website
projects.description: A sleek and interactive personal website showcasing my Web3 projects, blogs, and contact links, built to reflect my design aesthetics and engineering expertise.
highlights: Built a fully responsive portfolio using Next.js, Tailwind CSS, and Shadcn UI
Integrated GitHub, LinkedIn, blog, and project links for easy access
Highlighted featured projects with animations and smooth transitions using Framer Motion
Designed and deployed custom domain (https://yash-verma.me) for professional presence
Continuously updated with new content including blog posts, speaking events, and project launches

references.name: Aditya Gupta
references.reference: I had the pleasure of working with Yash for ~ 3 years @ RTSN. Yash consistently demonstrated a strong enthusiasm for learning and a proactive approach to challenges, quickly mastering complex concepts and applying them effectively in his work. His expertise in both frontend and backend technologies, combined with a deeper practical understanding of blockchain and Smart Contracts, was invaluable. Yash’s reliability, commitment to excellence, and positive attitude fostered a collaborative team environment. Beyond his technical skills, he exhibited a solid understanding of system architecture and excelled at communicating complex ideas to diverse audiences. Yash is a truly valuable asset to any team, and I recommend him without reservation.

references.name: Jithin KS
references.reference: I had the pleasure of working with Yash Verma at Time Space Ventures, now RTSN. We collaborated on RTSN, an innovative product for NFT creators to collaborate, which involved both frontend and backend development using React and Node.js. Yash's ability to quickly learn and implement new technologies was impressive. Despite being new to the project, he rapidly caught up and transitioned from a beginner to making significant contributions. His work on integrating ERC-721 contract showed his good understanding of blockchain technology. Yash's quick learning curve and adaptability will benefit any team he joins. I highly recommend Yesh as a blockchain fullstack developer.

references.name: Sachin Gurjar
references.reference: Having worked closely with Yash in our team, it's not just his technical prowess that stands out, but also his dedication to the broader vision of the projects we've undertaken. His expertise as a and full stack web3 engineer is evident in every line of code he writes and every solution he proposes. Yash has a remarkable ability to not only understand the nuances of today's rapidly evolving web technologies but also to forecast and adapt to future trends. On a personal level, Yash's open-mindedness and genuine interest in feedback have fostered a culture of mutual respect and growth in our team. It was not just about completing tasks; for Yash, it was about building something meaningful, efficient, and enduring. I wholeheartedly recommend him.

references.name: Abdul Moid Khan Mohammed
references.reference: I had the pleasure of working with Yash at RTSN/Time Space Ventures, where he played a pivotal role in my smooth and efficient onboarding. Yash is not only incredibly welcoming and supportive, but he also exhibits a genuine willingness to assist others at any time. His passion for web3 is evident in his dedication to learning and growth within the field. Yash's friendly demeanor and enthusiasm make him a valuable asset to any team, especially in environments that are as dynamic and rapidly evolving as web3 technologies.
